articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Russian Academy Ensemble
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Russian Academy Ensemble
 Pyongyang, October 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the leading members of the Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior led by Chief Viktor Yeliseev at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Sunday.
					 Present there was Valery Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Performance Given by Russian Academy Ensemble
articles.content:
Performance Given by Russian Academy Ensemble
 Pyongyang, October 11 (KCNA) -- A performance was given by the Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Sunday to celebrate the 64th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Among the audience were senior party, army and state officials, leading officials of ministries and national institutions, servicepersons and people's security workers.
					
					 Also among the audience were the Russian ambassador to the DPRK and his embassy officials.
					
					 Put on the stage of the performance were colorful numbers.
					
					 In such numbers as wartime songs "Polyusko-Pole" and "Song of the Soviet Army", the Russian artistes vividly represented the brave fight of the army and people of the Soviet Union with the ardent love for the country and the burning hatred for the aggressors during the last Patriotic War.
					
					 In dances "Dance of Russian Holiday" and "Gypsy Dance", they demonstrated dynamic rhythms and refined artistry.
					
					 They also put on the stage male solo and chorus "Eternal Friends of DPRK and Russia".
					
					 They sang well Korean songs "My Blessed Life" and "I Think of You, While Seeing You" to give deep impression to the audience.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Equatorial Guinea
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Equatorial Guinea
 Pyongyang, October 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, President of Equatorial Guinea, on the occasion of the 41st anniversary of its independence.
					 Expressing belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields, Kim in the message wished the president great success in his work for peace and prosperity of the country and happiness in good health.

articles.title: Korean Exhibition Opened in Hong Kong
articles.content:
Korean Exhibition Opened in Hong Kong
 Pyongyang, October 11 (KCNA) -- A Korean fine arts exhibition was opened with due ceremony in Hong Kong on Oct. 6 to mark the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and China.
					 Present at the ceremony were figures of the Hong Kong special administrative unit government, missions of the Chinese Foreign Ministry and different countries in Hong Kong and the "International Kim Il Sung Foundation" and the delegation of the DPRK-China Friendship Association and the DPRK consul-general in Hong Kong.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 The deputy representative of the Chinese Foreign Ministry to Hong Kong said that the exhibition is of special significance as it is held on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of the China-DPRK diplomatic ties. Through the exhibition the people of Hong Kong will get better understanding of the history and culture of Korea, he noted.
					
					 He stressed that China and the DPRK have understood and supported and assisted with each other the independence of their countries and the course of their socialist construction over the past 60 years while developing the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations provided and cultivated by the leaders of elder generation of the two countries.
					
					 We came to get convinced through Premier Wen Jiabao's visit to the DPRK that the China-DPRK friendship has struck its roots deep in the minds of the two peoples, he said, stressing that the exhibition would promote the development of the friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Int'l Organization Calls for Support to Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
Int'l Organization Calls for Support to Korea's Reunification
 Pyongyang, October 11 (KCNA) -- The International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea released a statement on October 3 on the occasions of the 29th anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo and the 2nd publication anniversary of the October 4 declaration.
					 The statement said that the DFRK founding proposal is the most aboveboard and reasonable reunification proposal as it contends that Korea should be reunified by founding a Federal Republic through the establishment of a unified national government on the condition that the north and the south recognize and tolerate each other's ideas and social systems, a government in which the two sides are represented on an equal footing and under which they exercise regional autonomy with equal rights and duties. This proposal aroused positive support from among the world peace-loving people as soon as it was announced, it noted.
					
					 It stressed that the October 4 declaration is a peaceful declaration for ending the military hostile relations between the north and the south and ensuring detente and peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 All the forces in the world who truly want peace and democratic development in the peninsula should fully support inter-Korean reconciliation and cooperation, it said, expressing belief that the Korean people would build a reunified thriving nation in the near future.

articles.title: Just Cause of Korean People Supported
articles.content:
Just Cause of Korean People Supported
 Pyongyang, October 11 (KCNA) -- Wahid Al Uksouri, chairman of the Arab Socialist Party of Egypt, issued a statement on Oct. 5 on the occasion of the 64th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The WPK founded by President Kim Il Sung has performed admirable feats in the revolution and construction while leading the Korean people's struggle as the general staff of the revolution.
					
					The WPK holding General Secretary Kim Jong Il at its highest post is honorably defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country and working hard to build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation under his wise leadership while courageously meeting all challenges on the part of the imperialists and foiling their moves.
					
					 We extend full support and solidarity to the cause of the WPK led by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK will emerge victorious in defending socialism and building a thriving nation without fail thanks to the wise guidance of the WPK headed by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We wish the WPK holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem a greater victory and affirm our invariable support and encouragement to the just cause of the WPK and the Korean people.

articles.title: Juche Idea Study to Be Intensified in Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Juche Idea Study to Be Intensified in Sri Lanka
 Pyongyang, October 11 (KCNA) -- The Gampaha District Branch of the Committee of Self-Reliance Studies in Sri Lanka was inaugurated on September 29.
					 The chairman of the branch was elected at the inaugural ceremony.
					
					It was stressed at the ceremony to intensify the study and dissemination of the Juche idea in Sri Lanka and expand the organization on the occasion of 2012 marking the centenary of birth of President
						 Kim Il Sung.
